title: Michigan Tribe Recovers Its Culture
teaser: The Potawatomi Tribe in Michigan nearly vanished in the 20th century. But young people are picking up the mantle to revive their culture.
contentencoded:
The Potawatomi Tribe in Michigan nearly vanished in the 20th century. But young people are picking up the mantle to revive their culture.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network Michigan Radio’s Emily Fox reports from the Great Lakes regions’ annual Pow Wow.

  • Michigan Radio: How a Potawatomi tribe lost its culture and what it takes to bring it back

Reporter

  • Emily Fox, reporter for Michigan Radio. She tweets @foxontheradio.
Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
